channel.title: How to disguise scar
channel.description:
[b][u]This is my first tutorial[/b]
Download SRL here:[url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,3617.0.html]http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,3617.0.html[/url]
This tutorial will teach you how to add a disguiser to your scar script. I suggest you know the basics of scar before using this tutorial.
Now I will ask you to open Scar it should look like this: [IMG]http://i132.photobucket.com/albums/q13/JSDarkx/pic1.jpg[/img]
Under program New; Write this [code]{.include srl/srl.scar}[/code] This includes SRL into the script which you will see where it's used later.
Right now you should be here: [IMG]http://i132.photobucket.com/albums/q13/JSDarkx/pic2.jpg[/img]
Now i'll ask you to make a space under {.include srl/srl.scar} then write [code]const[/code]
const is the place where you'll name your script.
Go to the next line and press space then write [code]Scar= 'Moparisthebest.com!';[/code] Between the apostrophes is where you write the name.
You should be here now: [IMG]http://i132.photobucket.com/albums/q13/JSDarkx/pic3.jpg[/img]
Go under begin and add [code] SetupSRL;[/code] As you can see this is what sets up SRL.
Under that write [code] DisguiseScar(Scar);[/code] This is what disguises scar (obviously)
Your final project should look like this: [IMG]http://i132.photobucket.com/albums/q13/JSDarkx/pic4.jpg[/img]
Now if you run it, it should compile and change the top bar to what you put in Scar= 'moparisthebest.com!'

@bobby wrote:

you can also just add in to the script: DisguiseScar(‘1337 Runescape cheatz’); and it does the same thing…

item.title: How to disguise scar
item.dc:creator: @XDark XDark
item.description:
@XDark wrote:

[quote=“cruel, post:10, topic:65706”]DisguiseScar(‘1337 Runescape cheatz’);
That good?[/quote]
It would be
Scar= ‘1337 Runescape cheatz’);

DisguiseScar (Scar); tells it that it gonna disguise scar what it says after Scar=

Read full topic

item.title: How to disguise scar
item.dc:creator: @rjop455 rjop455
item.description:
@rjop455 wrote:

I also created this for my mining script. It randomly changes names.

procedure ChangeWindowNameRandomly;
var namechange, changename:Integer;
    nameofwindow:string;
begin
  namechange:= namechange + 1;
  wait(20 + random(10));

  if(namechange = 20 + random(200))then
    begin
        namechange:=0;
        changename:= random (6);

      Case changename of

    1    : nameofwindow  := 'Winamp';
    2    : nameofwindow  := 'iTunes';
    3    : nameofwindow  := 'Runescape - the massive online adventure game by Jagex Ltd - Windows Internet Explorer';
    4    : nameofwindow  := 'Yahoo! - Windows Internet Explorer';
    5    : nameofwindow  := 'Google - Windows Internet Explorer';
    6    : nameofwindow  := 'My Computer';

    end;
    DisguiseScar(nameofwindow);
  end;
end;

Read full topic

item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

bobby:

well thats what tuts are for. making a power chopper isn’t that hard ether…

Yes but the powerchopper explains how to create procedures, this just tells you how to use one. It’s like a hello world but doesn’t exactly use as much effort.

XDark, what if the user doesn’t have SRL?

item.title: How to disguise scar
item.dc:creator: @XDark XDark
item.description:
@XDark wrote:

[u]This is my first tutorial

Download SRL here:http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,3617.0.html

This tutorial will teach you how to add a disguiser to your scar script.
I suggest you know the basics of scar before using this tutorial.

Now I will ask you to open Scar it should look like this:

pic1.jpg662×580

Under program New; Write this

{.include srl/srl.scar}

This includes SRL into the script which you will see where it’s used later.

Right now you should be here:

pic2.jpg655×585

Now i’ll ask you to make a space under {.include srl/srl.scar} then write const

const is the place where you’ll name your script.

Go to the next line and press space then write Scar= 'Moparisthebest.com!';
Between the apostrophes is where you write the name.

You should be here now:

pic3.jpg656×588

Go under begin and add SetupSRL;
As you can see this is what sets up SRL.

Under that write DisguiseScar(Scar);
This is what disguises scar (obviously)

Your final project should look like this:

Now if you run it, it should compile and change the top bar to what you put in Scar= ‘moparisthebest.com!’
